DataAnalysis_Functions module¶

Created on Fri Nov 15 15:21:22 2019

@author: riddaali

DataAnalysis_Functions.dataCleaning(df)[source]¶

This function takes the dataframe as an arugment.

  1. Filtering missing and meaningless values (e.g. Don’t know, refused, etc.) by using the loc technique.

  2. Replacing Feature values with their actual meaning by using dictionaries.

Parameters

[df] – [dataframe that will be used to carry out the data cleaning]

Returns

[cleaned (without NAs, meaningless values, renamed values) dataframe]

DataAnalysis_Functions.readFile(file_name)[source]¶

Creating this “readFile()” function to read the csv files. It takes the file name as argument.

1) Reading the BRFSS 2018 data: https://www.cdc.gov/brfss/annual_data/annual_2018.html Converting it from a “*.xpt” (XPORT) file to a dataframe.

PLEASE NOTE: I COULD NOT SUBMIT THE XPORT (‘LLCP2018.XPT’) FILE DUE TO ITS BIG SIZE (962 MB) SO IN ORDER TO EXECUTE THE FUNCTION BELOW, PLEASE UNZIP THE ‘LLCP2018XPT.zip’ FILE.

With the help of documentation available at: https://pypi.org/project/xport/

  1. Selecting features from the original dataframe by using the loc() function

  2. Renaming each column to improve its readability

  3. Converting each column into categorical variables

  4. Exporting the dataframe by saving it as a csv file

Parameters

[file_name] – [name of the file that includes the data]

Returns

[CSV file that has been created in the specified path]

Assignment 2
